attributes.comment:
As the parents of three internationally adopted special needs children we object to
the proposed fee increases for a COC. At this point we have spent considerable
money for adoption fees, federal government fees, and passports. We spent
money on passports in the belief that would be adequate for our children to prove
citizenship but have been informed that a passport is not as secure as a COC. AS
a result we will be forced to shovel out more money for the COC. I think it is time
for the government to provide FREE COC's whenever a child is adopted. It does
not seem fair that SOME internationally adoped children get COC's while others
do not. It is time to even the playing field and to stop discriminating against
certain groups of children. Therefore I propose to REDUCE the fees and in fact
make a COC FREE to adoptive children.
Sincerely
Cheryl L. Dieter
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Cheryl Dieter
